main_definition: To express dissatisfaction or disappointment with something, often referring to its poor quality, inadequacies, or negative aspects.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expressing general dislike or disapproval of something
meanings_and_examples.example: I don't like this movie; it just sucks.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Feeling frustration due to an unpleasant situation or outcome
meanings_and_examples.example: My computer crashed right before I could save my work, that really sucks!

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicating a lack of enjoyment in an experience
meanings_and_examples.example: The roller coaster ride was fun for everyone but me; it just sucked.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To refer to something as unappealing or low-quality
meanings_and_examples.example: I bought a cheap pair of headphones and they really don't sound great. They suck.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used informally to describe disappointing circumstances in life, such as failing an exam or not getting something desired
meanings_and_examples.example: Failing my driving test again is so frustrating; it just sucks that I can't get it right yet.
